info.title: Systems Management
info.description: Systems Management Service HTTP API. Manage and monitor your distributed systems.

parameters.description: The ID of the system to that the jobs belong

parameters.description: The salt function to run on the client

200.description: The list of systems matching the query

parameters.description: The ID of the system whose metadata to return

BaseResponse.description: Represents a basic response object containing an optional error.

jid.description: Gets or sets the job ID of the job to cancel.

systemId.description: Gets or sets the system ID that the job to cancel targets.

arg.description: List of arguments to the functions specified in the "fun" property.

tgt.description: List of system IDs on which to run the job.

jid.description: Gets or sets the ID of the job.

metadata.description: Gets or sets the metadata of the job.

arg.description: Gets or sets the arguments of the salt functions contained in the job.

tgt.description: Gets or sets the target systems of the job.

fun.description: Gets or sets the salt functions of the job.

workspace.description: Workspace to create the virtual system in

id.description: Gets or sets the ID of the system on which unregister operation failed.

systemId.description: Gets or sets a string representing the system ID for which to generated the API key.

GenerateSystemApiKeyRequest.description: Model for request for permanent api key to be used by SystemLink Client.

GenerateSystemApiKeyResponse.description: Model for permanent api key response for SystemLink Client to use when communicating with salt master.

pendingCount.description: Gets or sets number of systems pending approval to connect to the server.

GetPendingSystemsSummaryResponse.description: Model for summary information about the systems attempting to connect to the server but aren't accepted yet.

systemsPending.description: Gets or sets an object of system ID to key pairs that are pending approval or rejection. Keys may be pending when they are not pre-seeded via the automated registration process and attempt to connect to the master.

systemsDenied.description: Gets or sets an object of system ID to key pairs that have been denied. A key is denied when a system is trying to connect the master with a different key than the one that is accepted. This can occur if two systems have the same ID or if a key is removed from a system.

systemsApproved.description: Gets or sets an object of system ID to key pairs that have been approved. These could have been approved explicitly by the user or pre-seeded via the automated registration process.

systemsRejected.description: Gets or sets an object of system ID to key pairs that have been rejected. Keys are rejected explicitly by the user.

GetSystemsKeysResponse.description: Model for an object containing pending, denied, approved, and rejected system keys. If there are no entries in a given category, then the key representing that category is omitted. The value for the keys is in itself a dictionary, with the key representing the system ID and the value the public authorization key used.

name.description:
Gets the fully-qualified name that identifies the error code, such as
the output of M:NationalInstruments.SystemLink.ServiceBase.ErrorHandling.ErrorCode.ToString.

code.description:
Gets the optional NationalInstruments.SystemLink.ServiceBase.ErrorHandling.ErrorCode.NumericCode (not HTTP status code)
that identifies the error code.

message.description:
Gets the formatted error message, which is the NationalInstruments.SystemLink.ServiceBase.ErrorHandling.ErrorCode.Message
with NationalInstruments.SystemLink.ServiceBase.HttpError.Args inserted into any placeholders.

resourceType.description:
Gets the type of resource associated with the error, if any. Typically only
used for instances within NationalInstruments.SystemLink.ServiceBase.HttpError.InnerErrors.

resourceId.description:
Gets the ID of the resource associated with the error, if any. Typically only
used for instances within NationalInstruments.SystemLink.ServiceBase.HttpError.InnerErrors.

innerErrors.description:
Gets any nested errors if this instance represents more than one error. Typically
only set for instances related to NationalInstruments.SystemLink.ServiceBase.ErrorHandling.SkylineErrorCodes.OneOrMoreErrorsOccurred.

id.description: The ID of the system that the job targets.

createdTimestamp.description: The timestamp representing when the job was created.

lastUpdatedTimestamp.description: The timestamp representing when the job was last updated.

dispatchedTimestamp.description: The timestamp representing when the job was dispatched.

user.description: The user who created the job.

fun.description: Salt functions related to the job.

id.description: The ID of the system that the job targeted.

success.description: Whether the job succeeded or not.

activeCount.description: Gets or sets number of active jobs.

failedCount.description: Gets or sets number of failed jobs.

succeededCount.description: Gets or sets number of succeeded jobs.

KeyAction.description:
Model for action to be performed.
  * ACCEPT: Accept the associated key.
  * REJECT: Reject the associated key.
  * DELETE: Delete the associated key.

id.description: Gets or sets a string representing the system ID.

key.description: Gets or sets a string representing the public authorization key. If this field is specified, verification that the system ID is associated with this auth key will happen before the desired action is executed.

workspace.description: Gets or sets the ID of the workspace.

KeyRequest.description: Model for object defining a system ID and the action that should be performed over the key.

systemIds.description: The list of system ids for which to return keys.

keyActions.description: Gets or sets the list of NationalInstruments.SystemsManagementService.Model.API.KeyRequest

ManageKeysRequest.description: Model for request to perform specific acceptance actions to system keys.

skip.description: Gets or sets the number of resources to skip.

take.description: Gets or sets the number of resources to return. The maximum value is 1000.

filter.description:
Gets or sets the filter criteria for jobs or systems. Consists of a string of queries composed using AND/OR operators. String values and date strings need to be enclosed in double quotes. Parenthesis can be used around filters to better define the order of operations.
Filter syntax: '[property name][operator][operand] and [property name][operator][operand]'
            
Operators:
- Equals operator '='. Example: 'x = y'
- Not equal operator '!='. Example: 'x != y'
- Greater than operator '>'. Example: 'x > y'
- Greater than or equal operator '>='. Example: 'x >= y'
- Less than operator '<'. Example: 'x < y'
- Less than or equal operator '<='. Example: 'x <= y'
- Logical AND operator 'and' or '&&'. Example: 'x and y'
- Logical OR operator 'or' or '||'. Example: 'x or y'
- Contains operator '.Contains()', used to check if a list contains an element. Example: 'x.Contains(y)'
- Not Contains operator '!.Contains()', used to check if a list does not contain an element. Example: '!x.Contains(y)'
            
Valid job properties that can be used in the filter:
- jid : String representing the ID of the job.
- id : String representing the ID of the system.
- createdTimestamp: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp string specifying the date when the job was created.
- lastUpdatedTimestamp: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp string specifying the last date the job was updated.
- dispatchedTimestamp: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp string specifying the date when the job was actually sent to the system.
- state: String representing the state of the job.
- metadata: Object containg the the metadata of job. Example: metadata.queued
- config.user: String representing the user who created the job.
- config.tgt: List of strings representing the targeted systems. Example: config.tgt.Contains("id")
- config.fun: List of strings representing the functions to be executed within the job. Example: config.fun.Contains("nisysmgmt.set_blackout")
- config.arg: An array of arrays of variable type elements that are arguments to the function specified by the "fun" property. Example: config.arg[0].Contains("test")
- result.return: An array of objects representing return values for each executed function. Example:
  result.return[0].Contains("Success")
            
- result.retcode: An array of integers representing code values for each executed function. Example: result.retcode
- result.success: An array of booleans representing success values for each executed function. Example:
  result.success.Contains(false)

projection.description:
Gets or sets specifies the projection for resources. Use this field to receive specific properties of the model.
Examples:
    - 'new(id,jid,state)'
    - 'new(id,jid,config.user as user)'
    - 'new(id,jid,state,lastUpdatedTimestamp,metadata.queued as queued)'

orderBy.description: Gets or sets the order in which data returns.

data.description: Gets or sets the data returned by query.

count.description: Gets or sets the total number of resources that matched the query.

QueryJobsResponse.description: Model for response of a query request.

skip.description: Gets or sets the number of resources to skip.

take.description: Gets or sets the number of resources to return. The maximum value is 1000.

filter.description:
Gets or sets the filter criteria for jobs or systems. Consists of a string of queries composed using AND/OR operators. String values and date strings need to be enclosed in double quotes. Parenthesis can be used around filters to better define the order of operations.
Filter syntax: '[property name][operator][operand] and [property name][operator][operand]'
            
Operators:
- Equals operator '='. Example: 'x = y'
- Not equal operator '!='. Example: 'x != y'
- Greater than operator '>'. Example: 'x > y'
- Greater than or equal operator '>='. Example: 'x >= y'
- Less than operator '<'. Example: 'x < y'
- Less than or equal operator '<='. Example: 'x <= y'
- Logical AND operator 'and' or '&&'. Example: 'x and y'
- Logical OR operator 'or' or '||'. Example: 'x or y'
- Contains operator '.Contains()', used to check if a list contains an element. Example: 'x.Contains(y)'
- Not Contains operator '!.Contains()', used to check if a list does not contain an element. Example: '!x.Contains(y)'
            
Valid system properties that can be used in the filter:
- id : String representing the ID of the system.
- createdTimestamp: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp string specifying the date when the system was registered.
- lastUpdatedTimestamp: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp string specifying the last date the system was updated.
- alias: String representing the alias of the system.
- activation.lastUpdatedTimestamp: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp string specifying the last date the system activation was updated.
- activation.data.activated: Boolean representing whether the system is activated or not.
- activation.data.licenseName: String representing the name of the license.
- activation.data.licenseVersion: String representing the license version.
- connected.lastUpdatedTimestamp: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp string specifying the last date the system connection was updated.
- connected.data.state: String representing the state of the system.
- grains.lastUpdatedTimestamp: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp string specifying the last date the system grains were updated.
- grains.data: Dictionary of string to object representing general information about the system. Example: grains.data.os == "Windows"
- packages.lastUpdatedTimestamp: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp string specifying the last date the system installed packages were updated.
- packages.data: Dictionary representing software packages installed on the system. Example: packages.data.ni-package-manager-upgrader.version: String representing the installed version of ni-package-manager-upgrader package.
- feeds.lastUpdatedTimestamp: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp string specifying the last date the system configured feeds were updated.
- feeds.data: Dictionary representing the feeds configured on the system.
- keywords.lastUpdatedTimestamp: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp string specifying the last date the system keywords were updated.
- keywords.data: Array of strings representing the keywords of the system. Example: keywords.data.Contains("test")
- properties.lastUpdatedTimestamp: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp string specifying the last date the system properties were updated.
- properties.data: Dictionary of string to string representing metadata information about a system. Example: properties.data.owner == "admin"
- status.data.http_connected: Boolean representing the status of the http connection to the master.

projection.description:
Gets or sets specifies the projection for resources. Use this field to receive specific properties of the model.
Examples:
    - 'new(id,connected)'
    - 'new(id,alias,grains.data.host as host)'
    - 'new(id,lastUpdatedTimestamp,properties.data.location as location)'

orderBy.description: Gets or sets the order in which data returns.

tgt.description: Gets or sets array of strings representing the IDs of systems to remove from SystemLink.

force.description: Gets or sets a Boolean which specifies whether to remove systems from the database immediately (True) or wait until the unregister job returns from systems (False). If True, unregister job failures are not cached.

RemoveSystemsRequest.description: Model for request to unregister systems from the server.

jid.description: Gets or sets the job ID of the unregistration job sent to connected systems.

removedIds.description: Gets or sets an array of system IDs removed from the database immediately.

failedIds.description: Gets or sets an array of objects defining failed unregister operations.

RemoveSystemsResponse.description: Model for response of the request to unregister systems.

ReportType.description:
Model for the type of the report to be created.
 * SOFTWARE: The report will contain the installed software packages.
 * HARDWARE: The report will contain information about the hardware configuration of the system.

workspace.description: Gets or sets the ID of the workspace.

properties.description: Gets or sets the properties (key, value).

keywords.description: Gets or sets the new keywords assigned to the system.

properties.description: Gets or sets the new properties assigned to the system.

alias.description: Gets or sets the new  alias of the system.

workspace.description: Gets or sets the ID of the workspace.

systemId.description: Gets or sets the system id.

SystemUpdateInformation.description: Model for system ids and changes that need to be applied to the systems.

filter.description: Gets or sets specifies the filter criteria for systems.

SystemsReportRequest.description: Model for request containing the report type followed by a query filter that will be applied on systems.

count.description: Gets or sets the total number of resources that matched the query.

createdTimestamp.description: Timestamp that represents the time the system was approved

lastUpdatedTimestamp.description: Timestamp that represents the last time the system entry has been changed

lastPresentTimestamp.description: The time at which the last connection heartbeat was received for the system.

lastUpdatedTimestamp.description: Timestamp that represents the last time when the system connection information has changed.

state.title: SystemsState
state.description: Specifies whether the system is connected to the server and has updated the server with its data

connected.description: The connected information of a system

grains.description: The grains information of a system

status.description: The status information of a systme

packages.description: The packages information of a system

feeds.description: The feeds information of a system

keywords.description: The keywords information of a system

properties.description: The properties information of a system

workspace.description: The workspace information of a system

orgId.description: The org id of a system

removed.description: Indicates whether the system is being removed

SystemsResponse.description: Model for response of a query systems request.

connectedCount.description: Gets or sets number of systems connected to the server.

disconnectedCount.description: Gets or sets number of systems disconnected from the server.

virtualCount.description: Gets or sets number of virtual systems that have no connection to the server.

SystemsSummaryResponse.description: Model for summary information about the systems that have been approved to the server that are connected or disconnected.

systemsUpdateInformation.description: Data with which to update the information of one or more systems.
